job_description: Sr. Procurement Engineer/Supplier Quality/Aerospace/Grand Prairie, TX - job post LOCKHEED MARTIN CORPORATION 9,160 reviews Grand Prairie, TX 75051 Full-time, Part-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time Part-time Are you seeking new, challenging opportunities in Supply Chain Management? Do you desire to work at a respected company with traditional values, but an innovative mindset? Does the idea of actual rocket science seem exciting to you? Lockheed Martin’s Terminal High Altitude Area Defense (THAAD) Global Supply Chain team is looking for a passionate, detail-oriented problem-solver to add to its Procurement Engineering team. Procurement engineers serve as technical support to the GSC team chartered with reducing risk in the supply base. Candidate must have a strong organizational aptitude with excellent written and verbal communication skills, a desire to lead projects of varying complexity, and a thorough understanding of production processes, engineering design, and development processes. In this role, the candidate must be able to facilitate and support supplier issue evaluation and resolution, participate in change management, identify affordability opportunities, and perform capacity and capability analysis at a minimum. Other tasks include development and management of Statement of Requirements (SOR), process improvement or corrective action activities, supplier selection activities, PO Kickoff, and supporting the GSC operations team and initiatives. Basic Qualifications: Ability to obtain a secret clearance Bachelors degree from an accredited college in a related discipline, or equivalent experience/combined education Requirements development / management Experience with writing technical documents Excellent communication skills MS Office proficiency Ability to work proactively /self-motivated Excellent teamwork and team leadership skill Desired Skills: Background/Degree in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Manufacturing Engineering or similar field Experience with capacity analysis tools Risk Management Global Supply Chain experience related to acquisitions, proposals, and execution of a contract Comprehensive knowledge of requirements flow downs Security Clearance Statement: This position requires a government security clearance, you must be a US Citizen for consideration. Clearance Level: Secret Other Important Information You Should Know Expression of Interest: By applying to this job, you are expressing interest in this position and could be considered for other career opportunities where similar skills and requirements have been identified as a match. Should this match be identified you may be contacted for this and future openings. Ability to Work Remotely: Part-time Remote Telework: The employee selected for this position will work part of their work schedule remotely and part of their work schedule at a designated Lockheed Martin facility. The specific weekly schedule will be discussed during the hiring process. Work Schedules: Lockheed Martin supports a variety of alternate work schedules that provide additional flexibility to our employees. Schedules range from standard 40 hours over a five day work week while others may be condensed. These condensed schedules provide employees with additional time away from the office and are in addition to our Paid Time off benefits. Schedule for this Position: 4x10 hour day, 3 days off per week Lockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status. Join us at Lockheed Martin, where your mission is ours. Our customers tackle the hardest missions. Those that demand extraordinary amounts of courage, resilience and precision. They’re dangerous. Critical. Sometimes they even provide an opportunity to change the world and save lives. Those are the missions we care about. As a leading technology innovation company, Lockheed Martin’s vast team works with partners around the world to bring proven performance to our customers’ toughest challenges. Lockheed Martin has employees based in many states throughout the U.S., and Internationally, with business locations in many nations and territories. Quality Engineer (QE) Sr / Aero / Mfg. Processes - Arlington, TX - job post LOCKHEED MARTIN CORPORATION 9,160 reviews Arlington, TX 76018 Full-time, Part-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time Part-time Lockheed Martin is seeking a motivated and driven Quality Engineer for a position based in Arlington, TX. This position is for a Senior Quality Engineer supporting the PAC-3 Evolutionary Development and Transition to Production programs. The position requires previous quality engineering experience in developing and reviewing quality standards, methods, work instructions and procedures for the development of manufactured and procured products. Individual should be a self-starter who can work autonomously with minimal direction in a fast-paced dynamic environment. You will collaborate with Engineering, Manufacturing, Subcontracting, Program Management, suppliers, and customer to ensure quality standards are implemented and being met throughout the development of new hardware to increase manufacturability and enable a seamless transition of the hardware into production. This role requires strong project management skills, a strategic and forward-thinking mindset to constructively work with their cross-functional peers to ensure all Quality Engineering tasks and activities are proactively worked and completed in a timely fashion, and with precision. Role will also require monitoring performance of suppliers (internal and external), providing support for root cause and corrective/preventative actions, supporting supplier requests tied to program requirements, participating in Material Review Board (MRB) activities, providing technical liaison support related to quality engineering matters, auditing program and suppliers for conformance to requirements, and working closely with the Customer to ensure adequate acceptance of product. Lockheed Martin Missiles and Fire Control (MFC) is a recognized designer, developer and manufacturer of precision engagement aerospace and defense systems for the U.S. and allied militaries. MFC offers the vital capabilities needed to provide our war fighting and civilian customers the products and services they need in their defining moments. Quality engineering is seeking candidates to solve complex challenges and deliver innovative solutions that provide the best product for our customers, both domestically and internationally. Quality Engineers at Lockheed Martin Missiles and Fire Control act as an integrated member of the design and production teams developing and reviewing quality standards, methods, work instructions and procedures for the inspection of manufactured and procured products. In a culture of continuous improvement our department utilizes lean initiatives to reduce waste and drive affordability and efficiency. Working with an integrated team, which includes customer, suppliers and other functional personnel, non-conformances are identified, trended and resolved in a timely manner. As a vital member of the team, a Quality Engineer at Missiles and Fire Control supports various life-cycle phases of multiple development programs, where concepts are created, designs are evolving, advanced technologies are being tested, producibility being evaluated and preparations are made for a smooth production flow. Each development program approaches objectives a little differently, so flexibility is key. Basic Qualifications: Technical Degree at the Bachelor level or above Must have ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance Previous quality engineering experience in developing and reviewing quality standards, methods, work instructions and procedures for the development of manufactured and procured products. Experience collaborating with Engineering, Manufacturing, Subcontracting, Program Management, suppliers, and customer to ensure quality standards are implemented and being met throughout the development of new hardware to increase manufacturability and enable a seamless transition of the hardware into production. New hardware transition planning or New Product Introduction (NPI) experience Experience in design for manufacturing (DFM) or design to cost (DTC) Strong project management skills Experience (1) monitoring performance of suppliers (internal and external), (2) providing support for root cause and corrective / preventative actions, (3) supporting supplier requests tied to program requirements, (4) participating in Material Review Board (MRB) activities, (5) providing technical liaison support related to quality engineering matters, (6) auditing program and suppliers for conformance to requirements, (7) working closely with the Customer to ensure adequate acceptance of product and (8) interpret engineering drawings, performance specifications and other system integration technical data Ability to travel up to 25% Desired Skills: Engineering degree from an accredited college in one of the following disciplines: Aerospace, Mechanical, Electrical, or Industrial Engineering. One of more of the following certifications: ASQ Certified Quality Engineer (CQE), Certified Quality Improvement Associate (CQIA), Lean Six Sigma Green, Black Belt Certification Able to effectively communicate (both written and verbal) and interact with Technical Operations, Manufacturing, and all other stakeholders SAP/ERP experience Experience with Department of Defense customers A strong understanding of Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing (GD&T) Experience with performing First Article Inspections to AS9102 requirements Thorough understanding in AS9100 and ISO 9001 Quality Management Systems as well as AS9145 Advanced Product Quality Planning Earned Value Management System Cost Account Manager (EVMS CAM) certification Security Clearance Statement: This position requires a government security clearance, you must be a US Citizen for consideration. Clearance Level: Secret Other Important Information You Should Know Expression of Interest: By applying to this job, you are expressing interest in this position and could be considered for other career opportunities where similar skills and requirements have been identified as a match. Should this match be identified you may be contacted for this and future openings. Ability to Work Remotely: Part-time Remote Telework: The employee selected for this position will work part of their work schedule remotely and part of their work schedule at a designated Lockheed Martin facility. The specific weekly schedule will be discussed during the hiring process. Work Schedules: Lockheed Martin supports a variety of alternate work schedules that provide additional flexibility to our employees. Schedules range from standard 40 hours over a five day work week while others may be condensed. These condensed schedules provide employees with additional time away from the office and are in addition to our Paid Time off benefits. Schedule for this Position: 4x10 hour day, 3 days off per week Lockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.
